definition: taste/smell/(fig.) (noun suffix) feel/quality/sense/(TCM) classifier for ingredients of a medicine prescription

sentences.english: The office seems so dull and prosaic after Pine Ridge.
sentences.chinese: 從松嶺回來後，辦公室似乎變得枯燥無味了。
他過着枯燥無味的生活。

sentences.english: The insipidity of the meeting was exactly such as elinor had expected.
sentences.chinese: 聚會的枯燥無味恰如埃莉諾預料的。

sentences.english: The new job was not without its excitements.
sentences.chinese: 這份新工作並非枯燥無味。

sentences.english: Eg. He lived a cut-and-dried life.
sentences.chinese: 他過着枯燥無味的生活。

sentences.english: Life is doomed to be dull, but at the same time full of wonderful.
sentences.chinese: 人生路註定是枯燥無味的，可同時又充滿了精彩。

sentences.english: The next issue is that reviewing is generally dull and vapid .
sentences.chinese: 接下來的問題就是，複習是一個枯燥無味的工作。
